item.title: Pitselah add a quote by Raji Lukkoor
item.description: "Respond; don't react. Listen; don't talk. Think; don't assume." -- Raji Lukkoor

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "People use drugs, legal and illegal, because their lives are intolerably painful or dull. They hate their work and find no rest in their leisure. They are estranged from their families and their neighbors. It should tell us something that in healthy societies drug use is celebrative, convivial, and occasional, whereas among us it is lonely, shameful, and addictive. We need drugs, apparently, because we have lost each other." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by Ani DiFranco
item.description: "I know there is strength in the differences between us. I know there is comfort, where we overlap." -- Ani DiFranco

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by Dorothy Day
item.description: "We have all known the long loneliness and we have learned that the only solution is love and that love comes with community." -- Dorothy Day

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by C.J. Sansom
item.description: "We of alien looks or words must stick together." -- C.J. Sansom

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by Irvin D. Yalom
item.description: "Despair is the price one pays for self-awareness. Look deeply into life, and you'll always find despair." -- Irvin D. Yalom

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "I have had to experience so much stupidity, so many vices, so much error, so much nausea, disillusionment and sorrow, just in order to become a child again and begin anew. I had to experience despair, I had to sink to the greatest mental depths, to thoughts of suicide, in order to experience grace." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by Rohinton Mistry
item.description: "You see, we cannot draw lines and compartments and refuse to budge beyond them. Sometimes you have to use your failures as stepping-stones to success. You have to maintain a fine balance between hope and despair.' He paused, considering what he had just said. 'Yes', he repeated. 'In the end, it's all a question of balance." -- Rohinton Mistry

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "No reflection was to be allowed now, not one glance was to be cast back; not even one forward. Not one thought was to be given either to the past or the future. The first was a page so heavenly sweet, so deadly sad, that to read one line of it would dissolve my courage and break down my energy. The last was an awful blank, something like then world when the deluge was gone by." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by Carl Jung
item.description: "The majority of my patients consisted not of believers but of those who had lost their faith." -- Carl Jung

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "We shall not cease from exploration And the end of all our exploring Will be to arrive where we started And know the place for the first time." -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "I said to my soul, be still and wait without hope, for hope would be hope for the wrong thing; wait without love, for love would be love of the wrong thing; there is yet faith, but the faith and the love are all in the waiting. Wait without thought, for you are not ready for thought: So the darkness shall be the light, and the stillness the dancing." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "We die to each other daily. What we know of other people is only our memory of the moments during which we knew them. And they have changed since then. To pretend that they and we are the same is a useful and convenient social convention which must sometimes be broken. We must also remember that at every meeting we are meeting a stranger." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "You are the music while the music lasts." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "If you haven’t the strength to impose your own terms upon life, then you must accept the terms it offers you." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Whatever you think, be sure it is what you think; whatever you want, be sure that is what you want; whatever you feel, be sure that is what you feel." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "What we call the beginning is often the end. And to make an end is to make a beginning. The end is where we start from." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Anxiety is the handmaiden of creativity" -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description:
"For last year's words belong to last year's language And next year's words await another voice. And to make an end is to make a beginning."
(<i>Little Gidding</i>)" -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot.
item.description: "Where does one go from a world of insanity? Somewhere on the other side of despair." -- T.S. Eliot.

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Success is relative. It is what we make of the mess we have made of things." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "I love reading another reader’s list of favorites. Even when I find I do not share their tastes or predilections, I am provoked to compare, contrast, and contradict. It is a most healthy exercise, and one altogether fruitful." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "I learn a great deal by merely observing you, and letting you talk as long as you please, and taking note of what you do not say." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Teach us to care and not to care" -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "To arrive where you are, to get from where you are not, You must go by a way wherein there is no ecstasy. In order to arrive at what you do not know You must go by a way which is the way of ignorance. In order to possess what you do not possess You must go by the way of dispossession. In order to arrive at what you are not You must go through the way in which you are not. And what you do not know is the only thing you know And what you own is what you do not own And where you are is where you are not." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Distracted from distraction by distraction" -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "There is no feeling, except the extremes of fear and grief, that does not find relief in music." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "I must tell you that I should really like to think there's something wrong with me- Because, if there isn't, then there's something wrong with the world itself-and that's much more frightening! That would be terrible. So I'd rather believe there is something wrong with me, that could be put right." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Pitselah add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "To be nobody but yourself in a world which is doing its best day and night to make you like everybody else means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight and never stop fighting." -- e.e. cummings
